solution_line_template: The relay run is {length_multiplier} times the length of last year's race, so {last_year_race_length} meters x {length_multiplier} = <<{last_year_race_length}*{length_multiplier}={current_race_length}>>{current_race_length} meters.

With {num_tables} tables along the route, the distance between tables is {current_race_length} meters / {num_tables} tables = <<{current_race_length}/{num_tables}={distance_between_adjacent_tables}>>{distance_between_adjacent_tables} meters.

The distance between tables 1 and 3 is {distance_between_adjacent_tables} meters x {segments_between_table1_and_table3} = <<{distance_between_adjacent_tables}*{segments_between_table1_and_table3}={distance_table1_to_table3}>>{distance_table1_to_table3} meters.
